title: Quarrying crisis in Tamil Nadu’s Uthiramerur leaves residents in distress
content: Wells have gone dry and dust forms a thick coat over nearly every surface in the once sylvan landscape of Uthiramerur in Kancheepuram; quarries and stone crushing units are slowly eroding quality of life and leaving the residents in a belt of 60 villages in distress. Deepa H. Ramakrishnan and Geetha Srimathi record the tragic transformation of Uthiramerur

content: Niners coach Kyle Shanahan alternated between offering insight and declining to provide specifics on wide receiver Brandon Aiyuk's status with the team, a situation that he characterized as "extremely unusual."

content: A UAB football player was arrested after stabbing two of his teammates Saturday morning at the football facility ahead of the Blazers' home game against USF, a school spokesperson confirmed.

content: An emotional Chris Klieman said he was gutted after a 51-47 loss to No. 12 Utah, one of several close defeats the banged-up Wildcats have been dealt this season.

content: Devin Haney rolled to an emphatic win over Brian Norman Jr. to capture the WBO welterweight crown Saturday, giving him a title in his third division.

content: Diego Pavia threw for a career-high 484 yards and five touchdowns and No. 14 Vanderbilt beat Kentucky 45-17 Saturday to keep its CFP hopes alive.

content: Lap-by-lap analysis shows how Max Verstappen claimed a dominant win to cut into Lando Norris' F1 title lead.

content: A Wolfpack punter somehow recovered his own punt, which easily made this week's college football superlatives.

content: Chelsea weren't at their best vs. Burnley and got an important win, but they will need a bit more when facing Barcelona and Arsenal next.

content: Liverpool were thrashed at Anfield by Nottingham Forest, and they were poor at both ends of the pitch.

content: The Texas DPS released hours of video footage that details their search for Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland before he was found dead.

content: Four UCLA players, including Lauren Betts, are now projected first-round picks. But Spain's Awa Fam is No. 1.

content: Arsenal want to sign Juventus star Kenan Yildiz before other Premier League clubs do. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

content: The Avalanche's reign atop the list continues, and the Blackhawks break into the top 10. Here's the full list.

title: Grading preseason bold predictions for all 32 NHL teams
content: Some of our wild takes from September don't look so wild anymore. Others are way off base. Here's an update.

title: 'Withdraw your son': Woman recalls Delhi boy’s last words; alleges teachers torture him
content: A Delhi school student, reportedly distressed and claiming teachers "tortured" him, died by suicide near Rajendra Place Metro Station. He left a note accusing teachers of harassment. The Delhi government has formed an inquiry committee, and the school suspended four staff members amid ongoing protests.

title: Inside job: How a police constable 'trained' gang for Bengaluru's biggest cash van robbery; 6 held
content: Bengaluru police have arrested six individuals, including a police constable, in connection with a daring daylight heist of Rs 7.11 crore from a bank van.  A massive hunt across six states led to the recovery of Rs 6.29 crore, with the investigation highlighting insider involvement and meticulous planning by the gang.

title: Shocking! Mandhana–Muchhal wedding postponed; cricketer’s father unwell
content: Smriti Mandhana and Palash Muchhal's wedding, slated for this Sunday in Sangli, has been indefinitely postponed due to the cricketer's father's ill health. The family is requesting privacy during this difficult time. The couple, who made their relationship public in July 2024, had planned an intimate ceremony. Their focus is now on the father's recovery.

title: 'Fake news': French navy on Pak media reports on Op Sindoor; calls Rafale claims fabricated
content: The French Navy has debunked Pakistani media claims of a French officer confirming Pakistani air superiority and the downing of Indian Rafale jets. The Navy stated that Captain Yvan Launay never made such comments, clarifying his role was technical and he refused to comment on specific aerial engagements or Chinese systems.

title: 'Need to tell my story': Musk considers writing autobiography
content: Elon Musk is considering writing his autobiography to share life and career lessons, potentially covering his political involvement, Tesla's ambitious growth, and AI ventures.  While a film adaptation of Walter Isaacson's biography is in development, Musk's immediate focus remains on Tesla's future, with investors anticipating his dedication to the company's growth.

title: 'No intention to ... ': MHA offers big clarification on Chandigarh bill
content: The Union home ministry clarified that the central government has no plans to introduce a bill altering Chandigarh's governance or administrative structure in the upcoming Parliament session. This statement followed a political controversy over a proposal to bring Chandigarh under Article 240 of the Constitution, which had sparked concerns about Punjab's rights over the city.

title: Tejas crash: IAF pilot Namansh Syal’s mortal remains reach native village; last rites in Kangra
content: Wing Commander Namansh Syal, a decorated IAF pilot, tragically lost his life in a Tejas jet crash during the Dubai Air Show. His mortal remains were brought to his Himachal Pradesh village for final rites. Syal, a proud son of Kangra, was known for his bravery and dedication. The nation mourns this brave pilot.

title: US arrests tech company CTO and three others for selling Nvidia's banned chips to China
content: Four individuals, including two American citizens and two PRC nationals residing in the U.S., have been charged with illegally exporting advanced Nvidia GPUs to China. The conspiracy involved falsifying paperwork and using a shell company to transship the sensitive technology, which has AI and military applications. The scheme aimed to circumvent U.S. export controls, with over $3.

title: Pant says 'maarne de usko', Muthusamy sends next ball over long-on - Watch
content: Senuran Muthusamy achieved his maiden Test century with a patient knock, supported by Marco Jansen's free-scoring at the other end, as South Africa neared 500. Indian captain Rishabh Pant's tactical guidance, including encouraging a big shot from Muthusamy, proved effective. Their partnership bolstered South Africa's strong first-innings position.

title: Cyclone 'Senyar' likely to form over Bay of Bengal: 10 key points
content: A low-pressure system over the Strait of Malacca is poised to intensify into a cyclonic storm in the Bay of Bengal next week. Early warnings are in effect for heavy rain and strong winds across the Andaman & Nicobar Islands.

title: How much water should you be drinking every day: Risks of dehydration
content: Kidneys balance the fluids and the salts in the bod, and keeps the urine clear. Clear urine means a lower chance of kidney stones and urinary infections. When you do not drink enough water, the kidneys have to work harder to make the urine more concentrated. That extra work can strain the kidneys over time

title: $1 trillion squad: Musk, Zuckerberg, Pichai, and fellow billionaires break the internet
content: A viral AI-generated image of tech titans like Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg in a parking lot has captivated the internet. Dubbed the '$1 trillion squad,' the photo's cinematic style and the juxtaposition with a cheap motel room in a sequel image fueled a massive meme storm, reflecting 2025's AI-dominated landscape and the immense cultural power of tech leaders.

title: Mass kidnappings: Over 300 missing in Nigeria after armed raid on catholic school
content: Gunmen abducted over 300 students and teachers from a school in Niger state, Nigeria, marking one of the country's largest mass kidnappings. This incident follows a week of escalating abductions targeting both Christians and Muslims, with schools and churches being particularly vulnerable. Experts suggest these attacks are driven by criminal gangs seeking substantial ransom payments.

title: Explained: How new labour laws may cut take-home salary; raise PF & gratuity contributions
content: New labour codes effective November 21, 2025, mandate basic salary at 50% of CTC, potentially lowering take-home pay as retirement contributions rise. These unified laws aim to simplify compliance and boost worker safeguards. Expect higher provident fund and gratuity payments, impacting immediate earnings while enhancing long-term retirement security for employees.

title: Bengaluru shocker: Pilot 'sexually assaults' cabin crew member at hotel; booked
content: A case has been filed against a chartered flight pilot for allegedly sexually assaulting a 26-year-old cabin crew member in Bengaluru. The victim, who is from Hyderabad, reported the incident at Begumpet Police Station, leading to a 'Zero FIR' being registered. The case has since been transferred to Bengaluru for further investigation.

title: Stefon Diggs' lady love Cardi B raves about hospital stay after giving birth
content: Rapper Cardi B shared her positive hospital experience after giving birth. She praised the food and treatment, joking about getting pregnant again soon. Fans reacted to her comments online. Cardi B is preparing for her upcoming tour in February 2026. Her album 'Am I The Drama' was released on September 19.

title: 'You're not dumb, I am the one who trusted you': Bowler recalls what Dhoni said
content: Deepak Chahar recounted a tense moment from the 2019 IPL on Big Boss, where MS Dhoni entrusted him with death bowling against Sarfaraz Khan. Despite two initial no-balls, Chahar recovered, conceding five runs and taking a wicket in the remaining five deliveries to secure a win for Chennai Super Kings.

title: From Article 370 to Pegasus: Justice Kant set to take oath as CJI tomorrow; key cases
content: Justice Surya Kant, a distinguished judge, is set to become India's 53rd Chief Justice on Monday, succeeding Justice BR Gavai. With a tenure extending until February 2027, Justice Kant's career is marked by significant rulings on Article 370, sedition law, and Pegasus spyware. His contributions also span electoral transparency and gender justice within the legal fraternity.

title: Grand Udaipur wedding today: Trump Jr, Bollywood celebs to attend
content: US President Donald Trump Jr. joined celebrities like Jennifer Lopez and Justin Bieber in Udaipur for the wedding of US baron Rama Raju Mantena's daughter, Netra. The lavish event, held at Jag Mandir Island Palace, saw extensive security measures and performances by top artists, highlighting the Mantena family's significant connections.

title: Relief for Indian-origin families: Canada to overhaul citizenship-by-descent rules; check details
content: Canada's Citizenship Act is undergoing a significant overhaul with Bill C-3, poised to benefit thousands of Indian-origin families. This landmark legislation abolishes the "second-generation cut-off," restoring citizenship to those previously excluded and establishing a "substantial connection test" for future generations born abroad.  The law, awaiting its effective date, promises greater fairness and inclusivity for Canadian families.

title: 'Used as example of under-performer': Peers flag humiliation; Delhi student suicide case deepens
content: Classmates of a 16-year-old student who died by suicide have alleged he was repeatedly humiliated by teachers at St Columba's School. They claim his suicidal thoughts were dismissed by the school counsellor. Protests continue, demanding justice and a transparent investigation into the alleged harassment.

title: Ladakh violence: SC to hear plea against Sonam Wangchuk's detention on Nov 24
content: Sonam Wangchuk's wife challenges his detention under the NSA in the Supreme Court, calling it illegal and a violation of fundamental rights. The plea argues his arrest is based on stale allegations and aims to silence dissent, not address security. Wangchuk's wife also appealed to the President, alleging a 'witch-hunt'.

title: 'India backs early end to conflict': Jaishankar speaks to Ukraine counterpart
content: India's External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar spoke with his Ukrainian counterpart, reiterating New Delhi's call for an immediate end to the conflict and lasting peace. This comes amid complex developments, including a US proposal for peace and internal challenges faced by Ukraine. The conversation highlighted India's consistent diplomatic stance on the ongoing crisis.

title: 'Mazak bana rakha hai Test cricket ko': Pant's fiery message for Team IND star - watch
content: Stand-in captain Rishabh Pant's frustration was evident on Day 2 as India struggled against South Africa. Stump-mic recordings captured Pant urging his bowlers and fielders to maintain urgency and adhere to the over-rate timer, highlighting India's growing pressure.  Despite the team's efforts, South Africa's lower middle order continued to frustrate the hosts.

title: TVK resumes poll campaign: Vijay challenges SIR rollout; targets DMK for 'loot' in TN
content: Tamilaga Vettri Kazhgam chief Vijay resumed his poll campaign in Tamil Nadu, challenging the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision and criticizing the MK Stalin government for "loot and dynasty politics." Vijay emphasized his party's focus on moving education to the state list and conducting a caste census, contrasting it with "empty promises" on NEET.

title: 'Won't shut down': Al-Falah University to worried parents amid ED probe, NAAC notice
content: Al-Falah University assures parents it won't close amid regulatory probes and financial investigations. The Enforcement Directorate is probing alleged fund diversion and financial irregularities, leading to the arrest of the group's chairman. The university addressed a NAAC notice regarding outdated accreditation on its website, calling it an oversight.

title: 'Hand on shoulder, kiss on cheek': Gujarat cop named in teen's molestation complaint
content: A 19-year-old BBA student reported sexual harassment in a Vejalpur lift, leading to the identification of the accused as Inspector Barkat Chavda from the Gandhinagar control room. The student was kissed on the cheek by the man, who then exited on the sixth floor. Police have secured CCTV footage and are investigating the incident.

title: Smriti and Palash’s wedding: What’s the net worth of the power couple? - Find Out
content: Cricketer Smriti Mandhana and music composer Palash Muchhal are set to marry on November 23. Mandhana, a top earner with a BCCI Grade A contract and significant WPL income, has an estimated net worth of Rs 34 crore. Muchhal, a successful composer and director, is valued between Rs 20-41 crore.

title: ‘Don’t feel safe in Goa’: Russian DJ says 'rude cop abused us'
content: Two foreign women, a DJ and an actress, have alleged verbal abuse by Goa police personnel during a routine stop. The women claim a policeman used expletives and told them to "go to your country." This incident adds to a series of negative reports impacting Goa's tourism reputation.

title: Watch: PM Modi shares G20 highlights; calls discussions with leaders 'productive'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi described his G20 Summit participation in Johannesburg as fruitful, sharing key proposals on sustainable development, countering drug-terror nexus, and empowering African youth. He advocated for a global repository of traditional knowledge and a swift global health response team.

title: IIT Madras to offer free Machine Learning course in 2026; all you need to know
content: IIT Madras’ free 2026 ‘Introduction to Machine Learning’ course offers a concept-driven, maths-backed path into AI. Across 12 weeks, it revises probability and linear algebra, then moves through regression, SVMs, neural networks, trees, ensembles, clustering, graphical models and basic reinforcement learning. Designed for serious learners, it delivers IIT-level rigour online, with only the optional certificate being paid for learners everywhere.

title: Adorable! Smriti Mandhana’s viral dance with Palash Muchhal steals spotlight - Watch
content: Cricket star Smriti Mandhana and music director Palash Muchhal are celebrating their wedding with vibrant pre-wedding festivities, including a surprise coordinated dance. Their journey, which began in 2019, saw them navigate demanding careers while keeping their relationship private until a public acknowledgment in July 2024. A memorable proposal followed India's ODI World Cup win.

title: Sikar: 22 hospitalised, including 15 children after inhaling toxic fumes; probe under way
content: Fifteen children and seven adults were hospitalized in Sikar, Rajasthan, after inhaling toxic fumes near an industrial area. Preliminary investigations suggest the fumes originated from a furnace burning clothes. Authorities are investigating the incident, and affected children are reported to be in stable condition.

title: 'Will always be part of Punjab': Row over plan to bring Chandigarh under Article 240
content: The central government's move to bring Chandigarh under Article 240, similar to other Union Territories, has ignited strong opposition in Punjab. Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann vehemently protested, asserting Punjab's sole right over the city. This amendment, potentially delinking Chandigarh from Punjab's administration, is viewed as a significant political development, sparking renewed tensions.

title: Toxic smog chokes Delhi: Air quality turns 'severe' as AQI reading soars to 435
content: Delhi awoke to dense smog, with the average Air Quality Index at 381, placing it in the 'very poor' category despite GRAP-IV measures. Bawana recorded 'severe' pollution at 435. Authorities revised GRAP, shifting 'severe' AQI measures to Stage III, allowing work-from-home decisions for government and private offices.

title: Ciara on Russell Wilson: His maturity and 'fullness as a man' define their marriage
content: Singer Ciara revealed on the 'Angie Martinez IRL' podcast that her husband, Russell Wilson, despite being younger, acts as an emotional anchor due to his 'old soul' and maturity. She finds his grounded demeanor provides stability amidst NFL pressures and fame.  Ciara emphasized his 'fullness as a man' enriches their strong partnership.

title: From better digestion to relaxation: Why you should drink clove water at night
content: Drinking clove water at night is a beneficial habit. It aids digestion, reduces discomfort, and promotes relaxation. This traditional remedy supports the body's natural detoxification processes during sleep. It also offers anti-inflammatory benefits for overall health. Experts recommend consuming it before bedtime for optimal results. This simple practice can lead to better sleep and improved well-being.

title: Ashes: 'Two years ago you silenced India'- Shastri’s hard-hitting tribute to Travis Head
content: Travis Head delivered a career-defining innings in the Ashes opener at Perth, smashing a century off just 69 balls. His aggressive 123 off 83 guided Australia to a remarkable victory, leaving England captain Ben Stokes shellshocked. This performance reignited memories of his match-winning efforts against India in major finals.

title: ‘Tipu-Ipu ko maro’: Himanta backs dropping ‘Great’ from Akbar; row over NCERT move
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma backed NCERT's alleged removal of 'Great' from Akbar and Tipu Sultan's names, welcoming the change. While RSS leader Sunil Ambekar confirmed title removal, not historical figures, the move sparked political debate. Congress MP Imran Masood criticized it as rewriting history, while VHP spokesperson Vinod Bansal supported the revision, deeming Mughal glorification unacceptable.

title: Wedding day! Smriti Mandhana to get married today to Palash Muchhal: Inside her secret love story
content: Indian cricket icon Smriti Mandhana is set to marry music composer Palash Muchhal this Sunday in an intimate ceremony in her hometown. The couple, who kept their relationship private for years, publicly announced their engagement after India's ODI World Cup win. Muchhal's proposal at DY Patil Stadium and a tattoo of Mandhana's initials mark their journey towards formalizing their bond.

title: Smriti Mandhana set to tie the knot with Palash Muchhal today: All you need to know
content: Cricket sensation Smriti Mandhana is set to marry composer Palash Muchhal on November 23, 2025, in Sangli.  Their private wedding follows a triumphant World Cup campaign and a romantic proposal at DY Patil Stadium.  The couple, who kept their relationship private until July 2024, have successfully balanced demanding careers, showcasing a strong bond and mutual support.

title: Delhi blast: Accused doctors bought Russian weapon, freezer for explosives
content: Fresh revelations in the Jaish-e-Mohammed module bust in Faridabad expose a sophisticated weapons and explosives network. Dr. Muzammil purchased a Russian assault rifle for Rs 5 lakh, later recovered from Dr. Adeel's locker. Dr. Shaheen arranged for weapons and a freezer, with funds largely mobilized by her. The module's operational readiness and planning are highlighted by these discoveries.

title: Ind vs Sa: KL Rahul set to return as India’s ODI captain; Gill doubtful for T20Is as well
content: KL Rahul will captain India in the upcoming ODI series against South Africa, replacing Shubman Gill who is out with a serious neck injury. With vice-captain Shreyas Iyer also sidelined, Rahul steps in. Gill's recovery timeline is extended, raising doubts about his availability for the T20Is as well.

title: Rhodes attacked, AJ joins Rhea's War Games team
content: "SmackDown" was about teams that thrive and survive as Survivor Series: War Games approaches . AJ Lee is officially the fifth and final member of a group that includes Rhea Ripley, Alexa Bliss, Charlotte Flair and Iyo Sky .

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 12: Target the Brissett-Wilson combo in Arizona
content: field Yates, Daniel Dopp and Stephania Bell discuss Jacoby Brissett's fantasy performances since taking over for Kyler Murray . every Friday throughout the 2025 season, Matt Bowen will offer some late-week pickup options to fill those holes . there are a group of wide receivers providing both volume and upside worthy of consideration .

title: Gotham rides series of magic moments to win NWSL championship
content: rose lavelle was the star of the moment as the final minutes ticked away at PayPal Park on sunday . the 1-0 win at the weekend saw the league's inability to retain its biggest star due to the limitations of the salary cap . saturday's NWSL Championship was dominated by distress over the future of the Washington Spirit forward .

content: a 17-6 win over Missouri keeps the CFP dream alive . the Tigers outgained the Sooners in total yardage 301-276 . a dominant second half by the defense kept the visitors at arm's . "it's not pretty, but this is not a beauty contest. this is football"

content: the most interesting recruiting weekend across the country is in Blacksburg, Virginia, where Franklin and the Hokies are hosting some 2026 prospects . Davion Brown, ESPN's top-ranked uncommitted wide receiver, will step up his late recruitment with a trip to Maryland .

title: Projecting Tuesday's CFP top 12: No surprises, but Rivalry Week looms
content: the Sooners beat the Tigers 17-6 in Norman . there wasn't any movement in this week's top 12 projection . a dominant win against a now sub.-500 team isn't going to change the way the committee views Ohio State as the most complete team in the country .
